info.description:
APIs for Block configuration, such as creating, updating, fetching and removing codes related to blocks.
< This might include fetching the block cancellation reasons, or creating new block refused reasons. Wash schedules can be create, or new reservation methods could be added for a property.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 23.2.

This document and all content within is available under the Universal Permissive License v 1.0 (https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl). Copyright (c) 2020, 2023 Oracle and/or its affiliates.
info.title: OPERA Cloud Block Configuration API

get.description:
Use this API to get Block Cancellation Reasons.

OperationId:getBlockCancellationReasons

parameters.description: Determines wether to fetch inactive records or not.
parameters.name: fetchInactive

parameters.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in
parameters.name: x-hotelid

200.description: Response object for fetching Block Cancellation Reasons.

post.description:
Use this API to create Block Cancellation Reasons.

OperationId:postBlockCancellationReasons

parameters.description: Request object for creating Block Cancellation Reasons.
parameters.name: blockCancellationReasonsCriteria

parameters.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in
parameters.name: x-hotelid

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

Use this API to update Block Cancellation Reason.

OperationId:putBlockCancellationReasons

parameters.description: Unique ID of Block Cancellation Reasons.

parameters.name: blockCancellationReasonsToBeChanged

parameters.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in
parameters.name: x-hotelid

200.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

get.description:
This API fetches a list of configured status codes for the chain. It returns status code, description, and status type such as non-deduct, deduct, cancel, waitlist, inquiry, and actual. Status attributes, such as starting status, function diary visibility, allows pickup, and log catering changes are also returned in the response. Please note, that status codes are configured in a strict sequence that must be followed. In order to find available next statuses for the current block status, please use operation getNextBlockStatusCodes.

OperationId:getBlockStatusCodes

parameters.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in
parameters.name: x-hotelid

200.description: Response object for fetching block status codes.

post.description:
You can use this API to create a new block status code.

OperationId:postBlockStatusCode

parameters.description: Request object for creating a block status code.
parameters.name: blockStatusCodeDetails

parameters.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in
parameters.name: x-hotelid

201.description: HATEOAS links which help the consumer to navigate to resources

get.description:
Retrieve the next block Status Codes for a property.

OperationId:getNextBlockStatusCodes

parameters.description: When set to true, only configured next status codes will be included (available status list will not be included).
parameters.name: configuredOnly

parameters.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in
parameters.name: x-hotelid

200.description: Response object for fetch next block status codes.

post.description:
This API allows creation on Destination Codes. Destination Codes are used in OPERA Cloud during the block cancellation process, and they usually represent either a competitor hotel / chain, or a geographic destination that a specific block has been lost to.

OperationId:postDestinationCodes

parameters.description: Request object for creating Destination Codes.
parameters.name: destinationCodesCriteria

get.description:
You can use this API to retrieve multiple Sales Managers for a hotel, you can narrow the results using different search criteria.

OperationId:getSalesManagers

parameters.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: First name required to fetch Sales Manager information.
parameters.name: firstName

parameters.description: Last name required to fetch Sales Manager information.
parameters.name: lastName

parameters.description: Bearer token that needs to be passed which is generated post user authentication
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Mandatory parameter to identify the hotel code where the end user is logged in
parameters.name: x-hotelid

200.description: You can use this API to retrieve multiple Sales Managers, you can narrow the results using different search criteria

get.description:
You can use this API to retrieve individual Sales Manager Goals for a hotel, you can narrow the results using different search criteria.

parameters.name: offset

200.description: Response object for FetchWashSchedule operation which will contain all the information of 'WashCodes' like Days prior to arrival, Occupancy detail, Sell limit and Wash by percent value if exists.

blockCancellationReasonsCriteria.description: Request object for creating Block Cancellation Reasons.

blockCancellationReasons.description: Block Cancellation Reasons to be created.

blockCancellationReasonsDetails.description: Response object for fetching Block Cancellation Reasons.

blockCancellationReasonsToBeChanged.description: Request object for changing Block Cancellation Reasons.

blockCancellationReasons.description: Block Cancellation Reasons to be changed.

blockLostBookingCodesCriteria.description: Request object for creating Block Lost Booking Codes.

blockLostBookingCodes.description: Block Lost Booking Codes to be created.

blockLostBookingCodesDetails.description: Response object for fetching Block Lost Booking Codes.

blockLostBookingCodes.description: Collection of Block Lost Booking Codes.

blockLostBookingCodesToBeChanged.description: Request object for changing Block Lost Booking Codes.

blockLostBookingCodes.description: Block Lost Booking Codes to be changed.

blockLostBookingCodesType.description: List of Block Lost Booking Codes.

blockRateOverrideReasonsCriteria.description: Request object for creating Block Rate Override Reasons.

blockRateOverrideReasons.description: Block Rate Override Reasons to be created.

blockRateOverrideReasonsDetails.description: Response object for fetching Block Rate Override Reasons.

blockRateOverrideReasons.description: Collection of Block Rate Override Reasons.

blockRateOverrideReasonsToBeChanged.description: Request object for changing Block Rate Override Reasons.

blockRateOverrideReasons.description: Block Rate Override Reasons to be changed.

blockRateOverrideReasonsType.description: List of Block Rate Override Reasons.

blockRefusedReasonsCriteria.description: Request object for creating Block Refused Reasons.

blockRefusedReasons.description: Block Refused Reasons to be created.

blockRefusedReasonsDetails.description: Response object for fetching Block Refused Reasons.

blockRefusedReasonsToBeChanged.description: Request object for changing Block Refused Reasons.

blockRefusedReasons.description: Block Refused Reasons to be changed.

blockSalesAllowance.description: Response object for FetchBlockSalesAllowance operation which will contain all the information of sales allowance.

salesAllowances.description: Collection of Block Sales Allowance fetched.

blockSalesAllowanceRange.description: Operation to a create block sales allowance with date range.

criteria.description: Criteria to fetch block sales allowance.

blockSalesAllowanceRangeType.description: Indicates the block sales allowance for a date range.

cutoffDays.description: Number of days before sales allowance date, after which unused quantity should set to 0.

end.description: The ending value of the date range.

incrementFlag.description: Flag to indicate if the sales allowance update is absolute or relative to the current value.

overwriteExistingSalesAllowance.description: Flag to indicate if the sales allowance already exists for criteria then overwrite the records.

start.description: The starting value of the date range.

validateExistingSalesAllowance.description: Flag to validate existing sales allowance records within criteria.

blockSalesAllowanceType.description: Contains single entry information for Block's Sales Allowance.

allowance.description: Contains allocated number of rooms for allowance.

booked.description: Contains number of rooms are booked/consumed from sales allowance.

cutoffDate.description: Contains cutoff date for sales allowance.

overBooked.description: Contains number of rooms are overbooked from sales allowance.

blockStatusCodeDetails.description: Request object for updating block status code.

blockStatusCode.description: Block status code information to be applied.

blockStatusCodeStatusType.description: Simple type for block status code's room status type and catering status type. Valid status values are Waitlist,Cancel,Lost,Refused,Actual,Inquiry,NonDeductInv,DeductInv and Referral.

allowPickup.description: Indicates if the rooms with this status code will be allowed for pickup or not.

cateringInUse.description: Returns true if the status code is already used in Events.

cateringStatusType.description: Catering status type selected for status code. When the OPS Sales & Catering license code is active, the Sales & Catering status type for the status code is displayed.

color.description: Color code for the status code.

defaultReservationType.description: Default reservation type to be used for the status code. The reservation type and status code must have the same deduct/no deduct status.

inUse.description: Returns true if the status code is already used in Block / Event / Status Flow.

leadStatus.description: Indicates the default status for all new leads. Only one lead status can be selected as the default.

logCatering.description: Indicates if the status code logs the catering changes or not.

opportunity.description: Indicates that the business block created with this Status is an Opportunity.

orderBy.description: Indicates the order the status code is displayed in the status cycle.

reasonType.description: Reason type for every block reservation cancellation. Block Cancellation Reason, Block Refused Reasons, and Block Lost Reasons.

returnToInventory.description: Indicates if the rooms with this status code can be returned to availability or not.

roomStatusType.description: Room status type selected for status code.

showDiary.description: Indicates if the function diary will be shown within the Sales and Catering.

starting.description: Indicates if the status code is the starting status of the status cycle or not.

status.description: Code and Description used to define a status e.g. (INT, TENT, DEF, CXL) (initial, tentative, definite, cancelled).

codeDescriptionType.description: This contains a generic code and description information.

createSalesManagerGoals.description: Request object for Creating Sales Manager Goal(s).

salesManagerGoals.description: Collection of Sales Manager Goals information which should be created.

currencyAmountType.description: A monetary value expressed with a currency code.

currencyCode.description: Provides a currency code to reflect the currency in which an amount may be expressed.

destinationCodesCriteria.description: Request object for creating Destination Codes.

destinationCodesDetails.description: Response object for fetching Destination Codes.

destinationCodesToBeChanged.description: Request object for changing Destination Codes.

errorInstance.description: Complex type that contains error instance details for a REST call.
errorInstance.title: Error Instance Details

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

exceptionDetailType.description: Complex type that contains error details for a REST call.
exceptionDetailType.title: Error Detail

detail.description: Human-readable description specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: Absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.  It may or may not provide additional information if dereferenced.

o:errorCode.description: Application error code, which is different from HTTP error code.

o:errorDetails.description: Details of the error message, consisting of a hierarchical tree structure.

o:errorPath.description: Path to the problem at the resource or property level.

status.description: HTTP status code for this occurrence of the problem, set by the origin server.

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem.  The summary SHOULD NOT change for subsequent occurrences of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

type.description: Absolute URI [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.  When dereferenced, it SHOULD provide a human-readable summary of the problem (for example, using HTML).

instanceLink.description: Metadata describing link description objects that MAY appear in the JSON instance representation.

href.description: URI [RFC3986] or URI Template [RFC6570]. If the value is set to URI Template, then the "templated" property must be set to true.

method.description: HTTP method for requesting the target of the link.

operationId.description: The operationId of the path you can call to follow this link.  This allows you to look up not only the path and method, but the description of that path and any parameters you need to supply.

rel.description: Name of the link relation that, in addition to the type property, can be used to retrieve link details. For example, href or profile.

targetSchema.description: Link to the metadata of the resource, such as JSON-schema, that describes the resource expected when dereferencing the target resource..

templated.description: Boolean flag that specifies that "href" property is a URI or URI Template. If the property is a URI template, set this value to true. By default, this value is false.

title.description: Exact copy of the "summary" field on the linked operation.

nextBlockStatusCode.description: Request object for change block status code flow. Batch insert/update/delete of next status code list of a particular status code.

nextBlockStatusCodeList.description: Contains list of all available next status codes for a particular status code.

nextBlockStatusCodeDetails.description: Response object for fetching next block status codes.

blockStatusCodeMasterList.description: Block status code information e.g. Color, Description, etc.

nextBlockStatusCodeList.description: List of block status code flow which compose of a particular status code and its selected next statuses. Moreover, available next status can be not included if ConfigureOnly is set to true.

nextBlockStatusCodeInfoListType.description: List of all configured next status codes for the main status code.

nextBlockStatusCodeInfoType.description: Information of next block status code.

order.description: Order of next block status code

nextBlockStatusCodeListType.description: Block status code with its next configured and/or available status codes.

nextBlockStatusCodeType.description: Next block status codes information. Contains list of all configured and/or available next status codes for a particular status code.

nextAvailableStatusList.description: List of all available next status codes for the main status code.

nextConfiguredStatusList.description: List of all configured next status codes for the main status code.

reservationMethodsCriteria.description: Request object for creating Reservation Methods.

reservationMethodsDetails.description: Response object for fetching Reservation Methods.

reservationMethodsToBeChanged.description: Request object for changing Reservation Methods.

salesManagerGoalType.description: Detail Information about Sales Manager's goal.

activitiesCount.description: Specifies the number of activities of Activity Type being set as a goal

activity.description: Indicates if the Sales manager has Activity Goal

activityType.description: Specifies the type of activity being set as a goal

arrivalGoal.description: Specifies if this is a Arrival or a Production Goal

averageFBCheck.description: Average Food and Beverage check assigned for the Goal

averageRate.description: Average Rate assigned for the Goal

cateringCovers.description: Number of meals or covers assigned for the Goal

fBRevenue.description: Food and Beverage revenue assigned for the Goal

future.description: Use this indicator to fetch goal's having Production From or Arrival From dates later than the current business date or quarter

goalID.description: Unique Goal ID for the Sales Manager

groupRoomsWithCatering.description: Goal type used to fetch goals related to Group Rooms and Catering business

hotelId.description: Hotel Code of the Sales Manager

marketCode.description: Market Code assigned for the goal

nameId.description: Unique Name ID for the Sales Manager

otherRevenue.description: Other revenue assigned for the Goal

roomNights.description: Room Nights assigned for the goal

roomRevenue.description: Room Revenue assigned for the Goal

transientRoom.description: Goal type used to fetch non group goals related to Rooms business

salesManagerGoalsInfo.description: You can use this API to retrieve individual Sales Manager Goals for a hotel, you can narrow the results using different search criteria

salesManagerGoals.description: Collection of Sales Manager Goals information.

salesManagerGoalsType.description: Detail Information about Sales Manager's goal.

activity.description: Indicates if the Sales manager has Activity Goal

groupRoomWithCatering.description: Indicates if the Sales manager has Group Room with Catering Goal

hotelId.description: Hotel Code of the Sales Manager

nameId.description: Unique Name ID for the Sales Manager

transientRoom.description: Indicates if the Sales manager has Transient Room Goal

salesManagersInfo.description: You can use this API to retrieve multiple Sales Managers, you can narrow the results using different search criteria

hasMore.description: Indicates whether all the records are included in the response or not. Absence of the attribute values should be consider as all rows fetched in the response.

limit.description: Indicates maximum number of records a Web Service should return.

offset.description: Index or initial index of the set(page) being requested. If the index goes out of the bounds of the total set count then no data will be returned.

totalPages.description: Evaluated total page count based on the requested max fetch count.

status.description: Existing Operations Responses will eventually be modified to be extended from this type.

statusCodeDetails.description: Response object for fetching block status codes.

blockStatusCodes.description: Collection of configured Block Status Codes.

translationTextType2000.description: Contains Multiple translated texts and language codes.

defaultText.description: Default text with Character length from 0 to 2000.

translatedTexts.description: List of translated text and language codes.

value.description: Used for Character Strings, length 0 to 2000.

uniqueID_Type.description: An identifier used to uniquely reference an object in a system (e.g. an airline reservation reference, customer profile reference, booking confirmation number, or a reference to a previous availability quote).

id.description: A unique identifying value assigned by the creating system. The ID attribute may be used to reference a primary-key value within a database or in a particular implementation.

type.description: A reference to the type of object defined by the UniqueID element.

warningType.description: Used when a message has been successfully processed to report any warnings or business errors that occurred.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

rph.description: Reference Place Holder used as an index for this warning.

shortText.description: An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

warningsType.description: Used in conjunction with the Success element to define a business error.

washByRoomType.description: A representation of the single entry information for 'Wash by number of rooms' type.

occupancy1.description: Contains the number of 'Occupancy1'. Based on the parameter it should be replaced by the number of 'Rooms'.

sell.description: Contains the available Sell Limit rooms for a Sell Limit block.

washCodeDetailType.description: Allows for a choice to populate the detail information based on the choice between 'Wash by number of rooms' and 'Wash by %'.

daysPriorToArrival.description: Number of days prior to arrival of a block or block's cutoff day.

washCodeDetailsType.description: Wash Code Detail for a single entry.

washCodeType.description: A representation of the information contained by a Wash Code.

hotelId.description: Hotel Code to which the Wash Code belongs to.

washCodeDetails.description: Detail information of the Wash Code. It will contain number of rooms to be washed which is linked to a block by a Percentage or Specific number of rooms.

washCodesType.description: Wash Code, which will allow the user to define standard schedules that can be attached to blocks prior to the block's cutoff date to automate this process.

washScheduleCriteria.description: Operation to create new Wash Schedule Configuration under the selected property.

washCodes.description: Wash Schedule Configuration to be created.

washScheduleDetails.description: Response object for FetchWashSchedule operation which will contain all the information of 'WashCodes' like Days prior to arrival, Occupancy detail, Sell limit and Wash by percent value if exists.

washCodes.description: Collection of Block Wash Schedule fetched.

tags.description: The ChainConfigService Web Service offers capability of creating, managing, and retrieving of chain configuration.
